item1: Costco Wholesale Corporation its subsidiaries (Costco Company) began operations 1983, Seattle, Washington. principally engaged operation membership warehouses United States (U.S.) Puerto Rico, Canada, Mexico, Japan, United Kingdom (U.K.), Korea, Australia, Taiwan, China, Spain, France, Sweden, Iceland, New Zealand. item2: Item 2—Management’s Discussion Analysis Financial Condition Results Operations (amounts millions, except per share, share, percentages warehouse count data) FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS OVERVIEW operate membership warehouses e-commerce sites based concept offering members low prices limited selection nationally-branded private-label products wide range categories will produce high sales volumes rapid inventory turnover. When combined operating efficiencies achieved volume purchasing, efficient distribution reduced handling merchandise no-frills, self-service warehouse facilities, these volumes turnover enable us operate profitably significantly lower gross margins (net sales less merchandise costs) than most other retailers. often sell inventory before required pay it, even while taking advantage early payment discounts. believe most important driver profitability increasing net sales, particularly comparable sales.
